body_html:
it's not just the optimizer. We actually charter into a few other side-effects. hogwild will be broken for the linear layers:

  • you create model
  • send model to all processes (the weights have .share_memory_() called on them)
  • then you train model in each of these subprocesses.

This will be broken as well, because once you share a Tensor through, you cant resize it (and if you replace the placeholder with a new Tensor, sharing is broken).

body:
it's not just the optimizer. We actually charter into a few other side-effects. hogwild will be broken for the linear layers:
- you create model
- send model to all processes (the weights have `.share_memory_()` called on them)
- then you train model in each of these subprocesses.

This will be broken as well, because once you share a Tensor through, you cant resize it (and if you replace the placeholder with a new Tensor, sharing is broken).
